intro: Phoradendron solandrae, commonly known as the silver mistflower, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its ability to derive some of its nutrients from host plants while performing photosynthesis. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a distinctive silvery underside that reflects light. Phoradendron solandrae is often found growing on trees in moist, shaded environments, forming a unique ecological relationship with its hosts.
